comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to cnparm.home.texas.net/Wars/Marne/MarneBios.htm "Victor Constant Michel - De facto pre-war commander of the French Army. In 1911, he presciently guessed that Germany would invade through Belgium and advocated defensive measures; he was promptly sacked for lack of offensive spirit and was succeeded by Joffre. Appointed Military Governor of Paris in Aug.1914, Michel proved to be indecisive and was replaced by Galliéni. "

comment._content: another Bain Collection portrait photo:

comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content:
An interesting assortment of orders
Commander of the Legion of Honour - France
Officer of the order of Arts and Letters - France
Knight of the order of the Red Eagle - Prussia
Officer of the order of Nichan Iftikhar - Tunisia
Grand Cross of the order of St Olaf - Norway
Grand Officer of the order of Isabella the Catholic - Spain
one star (upper right chest) not clear
